      <<<<<<< HEAD:docs/reference/plot_image.html

      plot_image: Generate a ggplot object of the tissue image

      plot_image.Rd

      Creates ggplot objects of the tissue images when available within the STlist

      plot_image(x = NULL, samples = NULL)

      Arguments

      x

      an STlist

      samples

      a vector of numbers indicating the ST samples to plot, or their sample names. If vector of numbers, it follow the order of names(x@counts). If NULL, the function plots all samples

      Value

      a list of plots

      Details

      If the STlist contains tissue images in the @misc slot, the plot_image function can be used to generate ggplot objects. These ggplot objects can be plotted next to quilt plots (STplot function) for comparative analysis.

      =======

      color_parse: Creates a color palette

      color_parse.Rd

      Uses Khroma or RColorBrewer to return the colors of a palette name.

      Usage

      color_parse(color_pal = NULL, n_cats = NULL)

      Arguments

      color_pal

      A name of a Khroma or RColorBrewer. Alternatively, a vector with colors of lenght equal or larger than number of categories.

      n_cats

      The number of colors to produce. If NULL, assumes 5 colors.

      Value

      cat_cols A color palette

      Details

      This function takes a character string and uses either khroma or RColoBrewer to create a color palette. The function first looks in khroma, then RColoBrewer. In other words, khroma colors have priority.

      >>>>>>> 3db90f5bf04af3fb4f198dfb630dd1b87ad08ae2:docs/reference/color_parse.html
